prospects.name: Nay Sakya
prospects.audience: Aspiring players, parents seeking elite training
prospects.whyFit: Australian-based trainer working with elite levels. His audience wants serious development — exactly CourtLab's target. Position as tool for his players to track progress between sessions.
prospects.reachoutAngle: Offer CourtLab as player homework tool — track shots, vertical, drills between his training sessions. Affiliate commission on players who subscribe.

prospects.name: Dodo Elyazar
prospects.whyFit: Australia-based U12-U18 specialist. Runs camps/clinics nationally. Strong parent following. Tour recently completed but ongoing camp opportunities.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab for his ongoing camps — combine data at future events. Partnership for 2026 camp season. QR codes on player reports.

prospects.name: Garry Linton
prospects.contentType: Parent education, college recruitment, fixing youth sports
prospects.audience: Parents of serious youth players (especially boys)
prospects.whyFit: Strong parent-focused message — 'Youth Sports is Broken.' CourtLab fits perfectly (data = objective truth, no politics). D1 Dad credibility.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab as the antidote to youth sports politics — 'Stop guessing, start tracking.' His D1 Dad credibility + our data = powerful combo.

prospects.name: Jono Hansford
prospects.whyFit: Melbourne-based (perfect for VIC expansion), runs camps/classes. High follower count but Australian location is valuable. May have lower engagement due to size.
prospects.reachoutAngle: Position CourtLab as the 'homework' for his camp attendees — track progress between sessions. Affiliate for parents who want continued development.

prospects.name: Tyler Leclerc
prospects.niche: Skills trainer + Facility Owner + Coach Business Growth
prospects.whyFit: Micro-influencer with business angle. Helps coaches grow their business — CourtLab fits that narrative. Lower follower count = higher trust.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab as business tool for coaches — adds revenue stream, professionalizes offering. Affiliate for his coach audience.

prospects.name: Camille LeNoir
prospects.audience: Female players, parents of daughters, point guards
prospects.whyFit: Unique angle — female trainer, focuses on confidence/mindset. Appeals to girls' basketball market (huge growth area). Different from typical 'dunk highlight' accounts.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab for her 'DREAM' program students — track improvement, build confidence through data. Women's basketball focus aligns with Hoops & Her.

prospects.name: Ian Morris
prospects.audience: Sydney players, parents seeking personal coaching
prospects.whyFit: Sydney-based micro-influencer. Small following = high trust, personal connection. 1-on-1 coach = direct player relationships. Perfect early affiliate.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab for his training clients — track improvement between sessions. Micro-influencer with engaged local following. Early partnership = growth together.

prospects.name: Coach Russ
prospects.whyFit: Micro-influencer focused on helping coaches run better practices. CourtLab = tool they can use with their players. Very targeted audience.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab for his coach community — player tracking without the admin headache. Affiliate for coaches who want to add value.

prospects.name: Tony Miller
prospects.audience: Youth coaches, PE teachers, skill developers
prospects.whyFit: Educational focus — coaches trust him for methodology. College coach credibility. CourtLab fits as 'next step' after his drills.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab to track outcomes of his small-sided games — 'Are your players actually improving?' Data to validate his methods.

prospects.name: Matt Hackenberg
prospects.contentType: X's and O's, offensive concepts, strategy breakdowns
prospects.whyFit: Smart, analytical content — attracts thinking coaches. CourtLab's data approach aligns with his analytical style.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab as the 'stats layer' to his strategy content — 'Know your plays AND your numbers.' Affiliate for his coach audience.

prospects.name: Todd Marshall
prospects.whyFit: Focused on helping volunteer coaches improve. Large library of drills. Parents who coach = direct access to kids.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab helps parent-coaches track player development even without professional coaching background.

prospects.name: Sydney Basketball Academy
prospects.contentType: Skills training, team coaching, holiday programs
prospects.whyFit: Sydney-based academy with structured programs. Works with schools and clubs = B2B potential. Lower follower count but business entity.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab as their official player development tracking partner. White-label for their academy programs.

prospects.name: Asensi Elite Training
prospects.whyFit: Sydney-based elite training. 'Constraint-led approach' = sophisticated methodology. Small but elite following. High value per follower.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab to validate their training methods with data. Elite players need verified metrics.

prospects.name: Adam Gibson
prospects.contentType: Personal coaching, skills sessions, pro insights
prospects.whyFit: Australian Olympian, 450+ pro games. High credibility. Parents trust Olympians. Personal coaching = direct player relationships.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab endorsed by Olympian Adam Gibson — 'The data every player needs to track their journey.' High authority partnership.

prospects.name: Triple Threat Basketball
prospects.whyFit: Works with schools across Sydney. School partnerships = bulk player access. B2B opportunity through education sector.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab for schools — track whole teams, not just individuals. Bulk pricing for school partnerships.

prospects.name: Riley Parkinson
prospects.audience: Melbourne players, serious juniors, gym members
prospects.whyFit: Melbourne-based pro trainer, gym owner (physical location = credibility). 13K followers = sweet spot (engaged but not macro). Trusted by 30K+ on IG.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab for his Next Level Hoops Gym members — track training progress, showcase results. QR codes at gym for instant signup.

prospects.name: Brett Rainbow
prospects.contentType: Private training, classes, camps for kids
prospects.whyFit: Established Melbourne academy (Tomorrow's Stars). Head trainer with 10+ years experience. Proven track record with player development. Business entity = scalable partnership.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab as official player tracking partner for Tomorrow's Stars. Every academy player gets progress tracking. Bulk affiliate for parents.

prospects.name: No Limits Basketball
prospects.contentType: Elite skills, holiday camps, academy programs
prospects.whyFit: Melbourne elite academy. 'No Limits' branding aligns with CourtLab's 'Become Undeniable'. Works with advanced players who need data tracking.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab for elite academy players — prove improvement with verified data. Parents investing in elite training want metrics.

prospects.name: Chris from CG Hoops
prospects.whyFit: Melbourne trainer focused on decision-making (high IQ focus). Small following but specialized. 1-on-1 = direct influence on players.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab to track decision-making improvement — shot selection, game IQ metrics. Data to validate his training approach.

prospects.name: Chase Basketball
prospects.whyFit: Based at MSAC (State Sport Centres) — prestigious location. Works with schools across Melbourne. Multiple venues = scale.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab for Chase Basketball school programs — track whole classes. B2B through schools they serve.
